result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Expose Child to Harmful Descriptions, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
--------------------------------------------

Obtain and maintain full time employment, full time school or a combination of the two.
------------------------------------------------

Not to possess firearms or other weapons.
------------------------------------------------

No contact with V.R.S. or her family. 
------------------------------------------------
*AMENDMENT 5/2/2018 - Judgment of Conviction amended ; NO CONTACT WITH V.R.S. IS REMOVED. 
------------------------------------------------

Continue with therapy at Pathways until he successfully discharges from that program.
------------------------------------------------
Register as a sex offender and comply with requirements of Sex Offender Registry Program.
------------------------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
------------------------------------------------

11:07 AM  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given. 
Defendant Mark  Schmidt in court with attorney Mackenzie Renner.  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing.  
Court makes record as to charge.  A PSI was prepared.  
Court has reviewed the PSI and a sentencing memorandum filed by the Defense.  
Atty Renner has reviewed the documents with Mr. Schmidt.  
11:08 am  Atty Johnson makes record as to compliance with victims rights.  
11:09 am  Both sides are free to argue.  Atty Johnson advises that both sides are in agreement with the recommendations in the PSI.  
11:10 am  Response by Atty Renner confirming that they are in agreement with the recommendations in the PSI.  
11:12 am  Statement by defendant.  
11:13 am  Response by defendant to Court's questions.  
11:14 am  Court makes record and proceeds with sentencing defendant.  

SENTENCE:  
Withheld sentence:  2 years probation;  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
1)  Pay court costs.  
2)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
3)  Register as sex offender and comply with requirements of Sex Offender Registry Program.  
4)  No contact with V.R.S. or her family.  
5)  Obtain and maintain full time employment,  full time school or a combination of the two.  
6)  Not to possess firearms or other weapons.  
7)  Continue with therapy at Pathways until he successfully discharges from that program.  

Four (4) days sentence credit if probation is revoked.  11:18 am  Court in recess.
Deft-Sentencing Memorandum
Atty Mackenzie Renner

2:30 pm FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  ADA Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark  Schmidt in court with attorney David A Danz.  Attorney Danz makes record with regard to items that were seized which may or may not be new material.  Attorney Danz just received that information and indicates there are thousands of pages.  Attorney Danz has been contact with Detective Craig.  Attorney Danz needs time to review the discovery and is requesting this be put over for a status conference in 30 days.  Court cancels JT and schedules status conference.  Record is made with regard to compliance with victims rights.  Status conference scheduled for February 3, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

AMENDMENT 8-12-2016: NO CONTACT WITH ANYONE UNDER THE AGE OF 18 OTHER THAN WITH FAMILY RELATIVES WHEN SUPERVISED BY ADULTS.

MUST POST $1000.00 CASH
NO ACCESS TO CELL PHONES OR DEVICES THAT CAN ACCESS INTERNET OR ANY COMPUTERS.
  Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH V.R.S dob 01/05/2000. NO CONTACT WITH J.G.D. dob 10-28-1999. NO CONTACT WITH ANYONE UNDER THE AGE OF 18 OTHER THAN INCIDENTAL.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
